title: [BUG] nuget package error
body:
```
========================================
nuget-normal
========================================
Attempting to build package from 'HarfBuzzSharp.NativeAssets.Android.temp.nuspec'.
Successfully created package 'K:\AndroidUI-SkiaSharp\output\nugets\HarfBuzzSharp.NativeAssets.Android.2.8.2.nupkg'.
Successfully created package 'K:\AndroidUI-SkiaSharp\output\nugets\HarfBuzzSharp.NativeAssets.Android.2.8.2.symbols.nupkg'.
Attempting to build package from 'HarfBuzzSharp.NativeAssets.Android.prerelease.temp.nuspec'.
Successfully created package 'K:\AndroidUI-SkiaSharp\output\nugets\HarfBuzzSharp.NativeAssets.Android.2.8.2-preview.0.nupkg'.
Successfully created package 'K:\AndroidUI-SkiaSharp\output\nugets\HarfBuzzSharp.NativeAssets.Android.2.8.2-preview.0.symbols.nupkg'.
Attempting to build package from 'HarfBuzzSharp.NativeAssets.iOS.temp.nuspec'.
Could not find a part of the path 'K:\AndroidUI-SkiaSharp\output\HarfBuzzSharp\nuget\build\xamarinios1.0'.
An error occurred when executing task 'nuget-normal'.
Error: One or more errors occurred. (NuGet: Process returned an error (exit code 1).)
        NuGet: Process returned an error (exit code 1).
PS K:\AndroidUI-SkiaSharp>
```

comments.author: mattleibow
comments.body:
All the native binaries need to be built (or downloaded) and present on disk before packaging.

We could potentially build partial packages, but this could result in a successful build yet a corrupt package. For local testing, you can just use the `.\bootstrapper.ps1 --target=externals-download` and make sure all the files are there. Then you run any builds on top of that.

I initially had partial packages, but then I would need to verify each package contained all the bits. I removed that in favour of simpler packaging logic and reduced testing.
